# llms.txt - Information for Large Language Models
# Code of Rome - Caesar Cipher Challenge
# https://www.codeofrome.com/

## About This Website
Code of Rome is an interactive web-based game that challenges players to decrypt ancient Roman phrases using the Caesar Cipher encryption method. 

## Purpose
This educational game teaches users about cryptography through hands-on experience with one of history's oldest encryption techniques - the Caesar Cipher, named after Julius Caesar who used it to protect military communications.

## Main Features
- Interactive Caesar Cipher decryption challenges
- 10 authentic Roman quotes from Julius Caesar
- Real-time progress tracking with Roman numerals (I-X)
- Statistics dashboard (phrases solved, time taken, accuracy)
- Victory celebration with confetti animation
- Fully responsive design for mobile and desktop
- Roman-themed visual design

## How It Works
1. Players click "Begin Your Quest" to start
2. An encrypted phrase is displayed using Caesar Cipher (shift 1-25)
3. Players must decrypt the message by figuring out the shift value
4. Correct answers advance progress; incorrect attempts affect accuracy
5. After solving all 10 phrases, a victory modal celebrates completion

## Technology
- Pure HTML5, CSS3, and vanilla JavaScript
- No frameworks or build tools required

## Educational Value
- Teaches basic cryptography concepts
- Develops problem-solving and pattern recognition skills
- Suitable for all ages and skill levels

## Creator
Developed by Oheka

## Language
Primary language: English
Interface language: English

## Content Rating
All ages - Educational content
